title: Cogeneration makes productive use of waste heat

content.question: Which of the following is the best example of cogeneration?

choices.label: A power plant uses both coal and natural gas as fuel.
A trash-to-steam power plant accepts both residential and commercial waste.
Several power plants supply the same city with electrical energy.
Emissions from power plants are captured and stripped of sulfur for commercial sale.
A coal-fired power plant captures waste heat and uses it to heat adjacent buildings.

content.answer: A coal-fired power plant captures waste heat and uses it to heat adjacent buildings.
